thread.title: NASCAR fans are angry about Talladega ending, think Mike Helton is full of it
thread.title_full: NASCAR fans are angry about Talladega ending, think Mike Helton is full of it

author: jfoster@sportingnews.com (Jason Foster)
title: NASCAR fans are angry about Talladega ending, think Mike Helton is full of it
text:
NASCAR fans are angry about Talladega ending, think Mike Helton is full of it Sporting News 10 hrs ago jfoster@sportingnews.com (Jason Foster) NASCAR fans — and at least one driver — were apoplectic on social media Sunday after sport vice chairman Mike Helton said there was nothing suspect in the way the CampingWorld.com 500 ended at Talladega Superspeedway.
AdChoices Many fans took to social media to accuse Kevin Harvick of intentionally causing a wreck so he could stay in the Chase.
MORE: Sprint Cup: Eight drivers in the Eliminator Round
The caution ended Dale Earnhardt Jr.’s title run and led to Joey Logano being declared the race winner.
Harvick denied that his clipping of Trevor Bayne’s Ford was intentional, but fans weren’t swayed — with Harvick’s explanation or Helton’s review.
What a joke we have a car with no motor wreck the field to end the race. Complete crap. Sorry to anyone who spent $ coming to this circus
— Denny Hamlin (@dennyhamlin) October 25, 2015
@NASCARonNBC Mike Helton and the other NASCAR "suits" want to keep Budweiser happy. All about the money, as usual. So they turn a blind eye.
— Nelson H Bartlett (@nelsonhbartlett) October 26, 2015
Mike Helton = liar. "What we saw, there is no evidence...4 car [of Harvick] did that was questionable other than moving out of line". LOL
— G. Brock (@mickeysooner) October 26, 2015
@NASCARonNBC Mike Helton hasn't had a lucid thought since Dale Sr. crash.
— Gregg Chapman (@shanksalot65) October 26, 2015
@NASCAR #Harvick . He came on the radio and referred to a crash. Mike Helton you are gutless. Resign and let someone else lead. You're not!
— American Dad (@FMartin1952) October 26, 2015
It seems to me this NASCAR point system rewards dirty tricks & disrespect. Remember that in coming weeks @KevinHarvick & @joeylogano fans.
— Tom Beltz (@TomBeltz) October 26, 2015
@TheOrangeCone Here's a never before seen angle of @KevinHarvick on the last lap today... pic.twitter.com/lIZMph4dcM
— Dennis Riggs (@Riggler18) October 26, 2015
@NASCAR @joeylogano The end of that race was BS Dale Jr didn't even get a chance to race his way to the finish, 4 car screwed that up
— Mike Bretzing (@mbretz88) October 26, 2015
@KevinHarvick classless move. Worse is NASCAR and the people of @NBCSN for pretending it didn't happen. Don't insult our intelligence.
— David Rubin (@davidarubin) October 26, 2015
@KevinHarvick "My car is crap so I'll wreck everyone else! I'm a champion!" #NASCAR #TheChase
— Paul OBriant (@pobriant) October 26, 2015
© Mark Almond/AP Sprint Cup Series driver Kevin Harvick (4) drives past a wreck involving Sprint Cup Series driver Tony Stewart (14), David Gilliland (38), Danica Patrick (10) Trevor Bayne (6) during the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series auto race at Talladega Superspeedway Sunday, Oct. 25, 2015, in Talladega, Ala.
